bibl.title: H.W. Hull v. Washington Territory. Committment
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.ab: In the matter of the application of H.W. Hull for a Writ of Habeas Corpus | 3728
div1.p:
Now on this 25 day of April 1884 another commit an to be heard, and it appearing by the return of the Sheriff herein that the said H.W. Hull is in custody of him the said Sheriff with and by virtue of a certain exenflife) copy of a certain entity of reconginace and that unto by the said H.W. Hull as prinicipal and J.C. Nixon and W.J. Blackmill as certainties herein the said H.W. Hull and the said J.C. Nixon and W.J. Blackwell as surities acknowledging bond therefore herein and each of their heirs executors and adminstartors on the intended the to the Territory of Washington in the full sum of $500 00/100 for the appearance at the next Term of Supreme Court of the Territory of Washington term to be held in July 1884 in Olympia W.T. there to do and deliever whatsoever shall be awarded granting him in a certain case numbered 3473 affected by wherein the Territory of
Washington Plaintiff and H.W. Hull is deft. third of the October 1883 term of the court, wherein said H.W. Hull was convicted, and adjudged to be guilty, of the crime of Keeping a House of ill Fame and was therefore by the court ordered and adjudged to pay a fine of $300 and costs of Said action of that to be in the Court Judge of King Co, by offical said copy of said recognigance aforesaid the said J.C. Nixon and N.J. Blacks as sureties did surrender him the said H.W. Hull into the custody of said J.H. McGraw Sheriff, and it further appearing to the court herein that said H.W. Hull is enbtitled to be admitted to bail, pr his said appearance on said Supreme Court, it is accordingly so ordered that he be admitted to bail in the sum of $500, coherent the said H.W. Hull, an principal and the said W. Burnett as surety do recognize and acknowledge utenselize and of the them therein, and each of their heirs , and adminstrators unto the Territory of Washington the sum of $500 lawful money
of the United States to be levied upon their goods and chattels Laws and commitments.

The condition of the above application is such that wherein the said H.W. Hull was tried convicted of the October term of 1883 of this court adjudged to be guilty of the crime of Keeping a House of Ill Fame and at hereas the said H. W. Hull was ajudged by the Court to pay a fine of $300 __ and costs of said action and he explained to the Coustody of the Sheriff of King County with said fine costs to be paid or until by law; and counters the said H.W. Hull has taken an appeal from said Judgement and fine to the Supreme Court fo Washington Territory at the July Form 1884 to be held in Olympia W.T. now therefore of the said H.W. Hull shall personally appear and on said Supreme Courtr taken on the first day of said Court term therein upon day to day and time to time until discharged by law then the above objection to be void otherwise to remain and be of full force and effect.
